title: Patriotic/Victorian ID please
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081002050218im_/http:/typophile.com/files/AmericanEmblem_3788.jpg)

Does anyone know the name of this typeface? It has an interesting combination of both official looking strong letterforms as well as a few whimsical curlicues. This typeface will be used for the company branding of a Horsedrawn carriage company operating in a midwest river town celebrating their bicentennial. I need to find something that is classy and historic, and horsey- Main Street America... but not mistaken for wild west or circus.

Open to alternative suggestions!

 [‹ BOHLERT MASSEY INTERIORS logo](http://web.archive.org/web/20081002050218/http:/typophile.com/node/50043 "Go to previous forum topic") [Can anybody tell me what this is? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081002050218/http:/typophile.com/node/50041 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Plainandtall

comments.content:
You will find like fonts at Letterhead but you might want to read the EULA very carefully, it’s come under some (deserved) fire on this forum.

[http://www.letterheadfonts.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20081002050218/http:/www.letterheadfonts.com/ "http://www.letterheadfonts.com/")
Great news. The EULA has changed a bit. They now allow embedding in PDFs for starters.
I’m sorry- I don’t even know what EULA is... I just want to know the name of a font like this so I can purchase it. Did I do something wrong with how I attached this jpg?
No. We both had knee-jerk reactions. :^) Visit Letterhead Fonts, there must be something similar in their collection.
